title: ZachXBT Exposes WhiteRock Token as Potential $33M ZKasino Money Laundering Scheme
body: Prominent blockchain investigator ZachXBT has uncovered evidence linking WhiteRock Finance project to the notorious $33 million ZKasino exit scam, exposing what appears to be an elaborate money laundering operation. This scheme was designed to legitimize stolen funds through a seemingly legitimate real-world asset tokenization platform. The investigation reveals direct on-chain connections between WhiteRock’s marketing wallets, ZKasino’s stolen presale funds, and a personal email address that ties key team members from both projects together. 1/ Community Alert: At least one team member from the $30M Zkasino exit scam appears to be involved with the project @WhiteRock_Fi $WHITE due to onchain transactions linking both projects and a personal email address. pic.twitter.com/rZSvLM98fR — ZachXBT (@zachxbt) June 16, 2025 What is ZKasino? The ZKasino scandal originally erupted in April 2024 when the blockchain gambling project abruptly diverted $33 million worth of investor funds to Lido’s staking protocol instead of returning them as promised to presale participants. The scheme led to the arrest of team member Elham Nourzai by Dutch financial crime authorities, while alleged co-conspirators Ildar Ilham and Lior Ben Zakan reportedly fled to the Middle East. Following Nourzai’s release in late 2024, the stolen funds began moving through a sophisticated laundering network that employed chain-hopping across ZkSync, Starknet, EVM, and Solana networks. Proceeds were converted to Monero through instant exchanges, cashed out via OTC brokers, and traded on perpetual platforms like Hyperliquid. ZachXBT’s investigation reveals that WhiteRock emerged in late 2024 with immediate red flags, including an anonymous team without verifiable history, fabricated partnership claims, and funding sources linked to instant exchanges commonly used for money laundering. 4/ WhiteRock (WHITE) appeared late last year and a number of large red flags were immediately observed. -anon team w/o history -team called out for faking partnerships -team has many side wallets all funded via instant exchanges -team exaggerates number of users -USDX backing… https://t.co/e9DhRNzT1T pic.twitter.com/CC8olsxFvi — ZachXBT (@zachxbt) June 16, 2025 The investigator traced funds from ZKasino’s stolen treasury directly to WhiteRock’s marketing wallet, which was subsequently used to pay influencers for promotional content. Most damning, ZachXBT discovered that a personal email address associated with WhiteRock’s deployer wallet belongs to an account named “IldarTheGrandMaster” on Chess.com. This directly links the project to Ildar Ilham, one of ZKasino’s alleged masterminds, who operates under the alias “Prometheus.” From Presale Scam to RWA Revolution: The ZKasino Money Laundering Scheme The ZKasino exit scam represents one of the most brazen betrayals of investor trust in recent crypto history. It began as a promising blockchain gambling platform that raised over $30 million through presales before revealing its true nature. The project initially promised participants that their bridged Ethereum would be returnable, but when launch day arrived on April 20, 2024, ZKasino dramatically altered the terms. Instead of honoring withdrawal requests, the team converted all 10,515 ETH to ZKAS tokens at a heavily discounted rate of $0.055, subject to a punitive 15-month vesting schedule that effectively trapped investor funds. The deception deepened when investigators discovered that ZKasino’s supposed revolutionary blockchain was merely an Arbitrum Nitro chain lacking the zero-knowledge technology that formed the core of its marketing promises. Following the collapse and subsequent arrests, the stolen funds underwent sophisticated laundering through multiple blockchain networks and financial instruments. This multi-vector laundering strategy, explained by ZachXBT, mirrors tactics seen in other major crypto crimes. Australian authorities have charged four individuals over a scheme that allegedly laundered $123 million through businesses and crypto. #Australia #aml https://t.co/uV1errA8TV — Cryptonews.com (@cryptonews) June 9, 2025 Recent cases include Australian authorities uncovering a $190 million laundering network that mixed illicit crypto with legitimate business income and European investigations into OKX’s alleged role in laundering $100 million from the Bybit hack. How Stolen Millions Funded WhiteRock’s Success Story WhiteRock, launched on December 24, 2024 , positioned itself as a revolutionary platform that would bring traditional markets onto the blockchain. The platform quickly gained traction by promising to democratize access to traditionally exclusive wealth-building opportunities through its native WHITE token and USDX stablecoin. However, ZachXBT’s investigation reveals that WhiteRock’s impressive growth metrics and partnership claims were built on fraudulent foundations. The project’s marketing campaigns, funded directly through wallets containing ZKasino’s stolen funds, promoted fake partnerships with major financial institutions. 5/ I found an influencer who was paid via a WhiteRock marketing wallet and they confirmed they were paid from 0xfd978bcb706133403cf2fe0e07d872342c81266b Tracing out 0xfd97 shows a clear commingling of funds from the WhiteRock marketing wallet and Zkasino stolen funds. I also… pic.twitter.com/kGEy9POxz3 — ZachXBT (@zachxbt) June 16, 2025 StoneX publicly denied WhiteRock’s partnership claims, while supposed collaborations with BlackRock and First Citizens Bank lacked any verifiable evidence. The project’s most audacious claim involved rumors of a partnership with Saudi Aramco through Ripple to tokenize oil supply chains, which drove WHITE token prices up 110% on May 30 despite having no factual basis. ZachXBT has called for major exchanges, including MEXC and Gate.io, to delist WHITE token and conduct enhanced due diligence. The post ZachXBT Exposes WhiteRock Token as Potential $33M ZKasino Money Laundering Scheme appeared first on Cryptonews .

title: SEC Ripple Lawsuit: Dramatic Pause in Appeal Sparks Speculation
body: BitcoinWorld SEC Ripple Lawsuit: Dramatic Pause in Appeal Sparks Speculation Big news just dropped in the long-running legal battle between the SEC Ripple Labs! In a move that has surprised many in the crypto community, the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) and Ripple Labs have jointly requested that the court pause the ongoing appeal process. This isn’t a full stop, but a significant pause, and it’s happening because of a mutual agreement tied to a pending motion for an indicative ruling. The update was shared by defense attorney and former federal prosecutor James K. Filan on X (formerly Twitter), a reliable source for information regarding the XRP lawsuit . He noted that the SEC is expected to file a status report by August 15, 2025, giving us a potential timeline for when we might hear more concrete developments following this pause. Understanding the SEC Ripple Lawsuit Background Before diving into the significance of this pause, let’s quickly recap the history of the SEC Ripple case. Filed in December 2020, the lawsuit alleged that Ripple, its CEO Brad Garlinghouse, and Executive Chairman Chris Larsen conducted an unregistered securities offering by selling XRP tokens. Ripple has consistently argued that XRP is not a security. The case has been closely watched because its outcome has major implications not just for Ripple and XRP, but for the broader landscape of US crypto regulation . A key moment came in July 2023, when Judge Analisa Torres delivered a summary judgment that provided partial clarity: Programmatic sales of XRP on exchanges were not deemed investment contracts (securities). Institutional sales of XRP to sophisticated buyers were deemed investment contracts (securities). Sales of XRP by Garlinghouse and Larsen were also deemed investment contracts. This split decision was seen as a partial victory for Ripple and led to a significant positive reaction in the crypto market, particularly for XRP’s price. However, it didn’t end the case. The SEC subsequently pursued an appeal regarding the programmatic sales aspect, while the case proceeded in the district court on other matters, including remedies for the institutional sales deemed securities offerings. Why the Pause? The Indicative Ruling in the XRP Lawsuit Explained So, why would both parties suddenly agree to pause the Ripple appeal that the SEC initiated? The filing explicitly mentions a “pending motion for an indicative ruling.” This is a crucial legal term that provides the key to understanding the current situation. An indicative ruling is something a party asks the district court (in this case, Judge Torres’s court) to consider while the case is already on appeal at a higher court (the Second Circuit Court of Appeals). It essentially asks the district court judge to indicate whether they would be inclined to grant a specific motion if the appellate court were to send the case back down (remand it) for that purpose. In this context, Ripple has likely filed a significant motion in the district court related to the ongoing remedies phase. This phase deals with the penalties, disgorgement, or injunctions the SEC is seeking against Ripple for the institutional sales that Judge Torres ruled were unregistered securities offerings. Ripple’s pending motion could be anything from a motion to dismiss certain claims related to remedies, a motion challenging the SEC’s proposed penalty amount, or something else entirely that, if granted by Judge Torres, could significantly alter the landscape of the case. By requesting an indicative ruling , Ripple is essentially asking Judge Torres to weigh in on this new motion *now*, even though the appeal on the programmatic sales is ongoing. If Judge Torres indicates she would grant the motion, it could potentially resolve or narrow key issues currently being debated in the remedies phase, and perhaps even impact the basis or necessity of the pending appeal. Implications of the Pause for the Ripple Appeal The decision by both the SEC and Ripple to jointly request this pause is quite telling. It suggests that whatever Ripple’s pending motion entails, both parties agree that getting Judge Torres’s perspective on it is a necessary or beneficial step before the Ripple appeal proceeds further. Here are some potential implications: Potential for Efficiency: If Judge Torres indicates she would grant Ripple’s motion, it could streamline the entire process. It might lead to a settlement, narrow the scope of the remedies trial, or even influence the SEC’s stance on the appeal. Ripple’s Confidence: Filing a motion for an indicative ruling suggests Ripple believes they have strong grounds for it and that Judge Torres might rule in their favor. SEC’s Calculation: The SEC agreeing to the pause indicates they also see value in Judge Torres’s input on the pending motion. It could be a strategic move to avoid unnecessary litigation on appeal if the district court’s ruling on the motion resolves key issues. Delayed Appeal Resolution: While potentially leading to a more efficient overall resolution, the immediate effect is a pause in the Ripple appeal itself. The ultimate outcome of the appeal on programmatic sales remains pending until the pause is lifted and the process resumes. It’s important to note that an indicative ruling is just that – an indication. Judge Torres isn’t *actually* ruling on the motion yet. She’s indicating what she *would* do if the case were remanded to her. The appellate court would still need to formally remand the case for her to issue a binding ruling. What This Development Means for US Crypto Regulation The SEC Ripple case has been a cornerstone in the ongoing debate about US crypto regulation . The initial ruling provided some of the first judicial clarity on how existing securities laws might apply to digital assets. This latest development, while procedural, underscores the complexity and evolving nature of this regulatory landscape. The outcome of the remedies phase, which is the focus of Ripple’s pending motion, will determine the final financial penalties and restrictions imposed on Ripple for the institutional sales. This will set a precedent for how the SEC might seek to penalize other crypto companies found to have conducted unregistered securities offerings. Furthermore, the eventual resolution of the appeal regarding programmatic sales will either solidify or challenge the current legal stance on exchange-based crypto trading under securities law. This case is bigger than just Ripple and XRP; it’s shaping the future of digital asset operations within the United States. Businesses, investors, and developers in the crypto space are all watching closely, as the final judgment will significantly influence how they operate, raise funds, and interact with digital assets under US crypto regulation . Looking Ahead: Potential Outcomes for the SEC Ripple Case With the appeal paused pending a decision on the indicative ruling , what are the possible paths forward for the SEC Ripple case? Judge Torres Indicates Granting the Motion: If Judge Torres signals she would grant Ripple’s pending motion (either fully or partially), it could significantly weaken the SEC’s position in the remedies phase and potentially impact the appeal. This could pave the way for a settlement or a more favorable final judgment for Ripple. Judge Torres Indicates Denying the Motion: If she indicates she would deny the motion, the remedies phase would likely continue as planned, and the appeal on programmatic sales would resume with the current summary judgment ruling intact. Settlement Talks Intensify: The joint request for a pause could be a sign that both parties are actively engaged in settlement discussions. Getting clarity from Judge Torres via the indicative ruling process might be a step towards finding common ground. Appeal Resumes: Regardless of the indicative ruling’s outcome, if no settlement is reached, the appeal process at the Second Circuit will eventually resume after the pause, potentially leading to a final ruling on the programmatic sales aspect sometime in the future (keeping in mind the August 15, 2025, status report deadline). The legal maneuvering highlights the high stakes involved. Both sides are using available legal tools to position themselves advantageously. The request for an indicative ruling is a sophisticated tactic that could significantly alter the trajectory of this landmark case. Conclusion: Awaiting the Next Move in the SEC Ripple Saga The joint request by the SEC and Ripple Labs to pause the Ripple appeal marks another fascinating turn in a case that has already seen numerous twists and turns. The focus now shifts to Ripple’s pending motion and the subsequent request for an indicative ruling from Judge Torres. While the pause introduces further delay in the appellate process, it also opens the door to potential efficiencies and perhaps even increases the likelihood of a settlement, depending on Judge Torres’s inclination regarding the pending motion. For anyone following the XRP lawsuit or interested in the future of US crypto regulation , this development is a clear reminder that the legal battles shaping the industry are far from over. The coming months, leading up to the August 2025 status report, will be critical in determining the next steps in this pivotal case. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our articles on key developments shaping US crypto regulation. This post SEC Ripple Lawsuit: Dramatic Pause in Appeal Sparks Speculation first appeared on BitcoinWorld and is written by Editorial Team

title: Elizabeth Warren Slams Stablecoin Bill, Says “This Helps Musk and Trump Get Rich”
body: The post Elizabeth Warren Slams Stablecoin Bill, Says “This Helps Musk and Trump Get Rich” appeared first on Coinpedia Fintech News The GENIUS Act, a bipartisan bill to regulate payment stablecoins, is now at the center of a major controversy. U.S. Senator Elizabeth Warren has raised alarms, warning that billionaires like Elon Musk and Jeff Bezos could abuse the system if critical loopholes aren’t fixed. Her warning has ignited a heated debate in the crypto community and among lawmakers. So, what exactly is the GENIUS Act , and why is it drawing so much attention? What Is the GENIUS Act? The GENIUS Act is a proposed U.S. Senate bill aiming to establish a federal framework for payment stablecoins. It sets out: Rules for issuance and transparency Reserve requirements for stablecoin providers Clear oversight roles for regulators The bill recently cleared a cloture vote and is now headed for a full Senate floor vote, where several amendments are expected to be considered. Warren’s Warning: “Billionaires Could Track Your Spending” Senator Elizabeth Warren took to X (formerly Twitter) to issue a sharp warning: “If Congress doesn’t fix the GENIUS Act, billionaires like Elon Musk and Jeff Bezos could launch stablecoins that track your purchases, exploit your data, and squeeze out competitors.” Warren’s statement highlights a key concern: if tech giants gain control over both stablecoin issuance and the platforms on which they operate, it could create a dangerous data monopoly. Musk and Bezos Eyeing Stablecoins? Elon Musk Reports suggest Musk’s company X is exploring stablecoin integration through its X Money initiative, with the goal of enabling peer-to-peer payments and reducing transaction fees. Jeff Bezos Speculation is swirling that Amazon is also developing a USD-backed stablecoin , aiming to cut costs and streamline online payments. These potential moves by tech titans are exactly what Warren fears—corporate dominance over digital money and consumer data. The Consumer Risk: Privacy at Stake? Stablecoin transactions are recorded on public blockchains. But if a corporation controls both the stablecoin and the user platform, it could: Connect your wallet to your profile Monitor spending behavior in real-time Use the data for hyper-targeted ads, dynamic pricing, or even sell it to third parties This raises major privacy and surveillance concerns. Trump, Stablecoins, and the Politics of Regulation Senator Warren also warned of another risk: bailouts. If corporate stablecoins crash, taxpayers might be on the hook. Adding fuel to the fire, President Donald Trump is now tied to a controversial stablecoin project. Trump’s Crypto Empire: World Liberty Financial World Liberty Financial (WLF) was launched in 2024 Trump serves as “Chief Crypto Advocate” His sons are listed as “Web3 Ambassadors.” A Trump-affiliated entity owns 60% of WLF and receives 75% of revenue WLF has raised over $550 million and issued a USD1 stablecoin , backed by U.S. Treasuries and cash equivalents. While Trump’s support for crypto aligns with his campaign promises, critics question whether there’s a conflict of interest. .article-inside-link { margin-left: 0 !important; border: 1px solid #0052CC4D; border-left: 0; border-right: 0; padding: 10px 0; text-align: left; } .entry ul.article-inside-link li { font-size: 14px; line-height: 21px; font-weight: 600; list-style-type: none; margin-bottom: 0; display: inline-block; } .entry ul.article-inside-link li:last-child { display: none; } Also Read : Crypto Market Today: Bitcoin Dips, XRP Pulls Back, Ethereum Lags Ahead of FOMC , Supporters vs Critics: The Stablecoin Divide Not everyone agrees with Warren. Fred Rispoli, a pro-crypto lawyer, argues the GENIUS Act could break big banks’ monopoly on consumer data. Others believe corporate stablecoins could boost innovation and financial inclusion. Critics also accuse Warren of hypocrisy for backing a government-run digital currency with similar data risks. Previous concerns around money laundering, foreign coins, and corporate involvement have been partially addressed in the bill, but the privacy debate remains unresolved. Final Vote Ahead: Will GENIUS Be Rewritten? The GENIUS Act is still evolving. As it heads to a full Senate vote, amendments may reshape its final form.But one thing is clear: the outcome will significantly impact the future of stablecoins in the U.S.—and the power tech giants may (or may not) have over them. .article_register_shortcode { padding: 18px 24px; border-radius: 8px; display: flex; align-items: center; margin: 6px 0 22px; border: 1px solid #0052CC4D; background: linear-gradient(90deg, rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.1) 0%, rgba(0, 82, 204, 0.1) 100%); } .article_register_shortcode .media-body h5 { color: #000000; font-weight: 600; font-size: 20px; line-height: 22px; text-align:left; } .article_register_shortcode .media-body h5 span { color: #0052CC; } .article_register_shortcode .media-body p { font-weight: 400; font-size: 14px; line-height: 22px; color: #171717B2; margin-top: 4px; text-align:left; } .article_register_shortcode .media-body{ padding-right: 14px; } .article_register_shortcode .media-button a { float: right; } .article_register_shortcode .primary-button img{ vertical-align: middle; width: 20px; margin: 0; display: inline-block; } @media (min-width: 581px) and (max-width: 991px) { .article_register_shortcode .media-body p { margin-bottom: 0; } } @media (max-width: 580px) { .article_register_shortcode { display: block; padding: 20px; } .article_register_shortcode img { max-width: 50px; } .article_register_shortcode .media-body h5 { font-size: 16px; } .article_register_shortcode .media-body { margin-left: 0px; } .article_register_shortcode .media-body p { font-size: 13px; line-height: 20px; margin-top: 6px; margin-bottom: 14px; } .article_register_shortcode .media-button a { float: unset; } .article_register_shortcode .secondary-button { margin-bottom: 0; } } Never Miss a Beat in the Crypto World! anyActive = true; // Set anyActive to true } else { item.classList.remove('active'); // Remove 'active' class if checkbox is unchecked } } }); // Update the button text based on whether any list item has the 'active' class updateButtonText(anyActive); } document.addEventListener('click', function(event) { var clickedItem = event.target.closest('.subscription-options li'); if (clickedItem) { var checkbox = clickedItem.querySelector('input[type="checkbox"]'); if (checkbox) { checkbox.checked = !checkbox.checked; updateSubscriptionButton(); } } });

title: New Ripple Ad Just Dropped In NYC: XRP Is Making Moves, Something Big Is Unfolding
body: Crypto enthusiast CryptoSensei announced a new development on X, highlighting the unveiling of a new Ripple advertisement in New York City. In a tweet describing the update, CryptoSensei stated, “Massive news! A brand-new Ripple ad just dropped in NYC. Something big is unfolding, #XRP is making moves!” The tweet was accompanied by images showing Ripple’s visual presence at a major transit location, suggesting a renewed effort by the company to gain visibility in one of the world’s most prominent financial cities. Massive news! A brand-new Ripple ad just dropped in NYC. Something big is unfolding, #XRP is making moves! pic.twitter.com/XYcvaYQlfc — CryptoSensei (@Crypt0Senseii) June 14, 2025 The advertisement was reportedly spotted at the Fulton Center in Manhattan, a major transportation hub. A user identified as cryptofanatic corroborated CryptoSensei’s post, commenting that the ad appears regularly at the location. Specifically, cryptofanatic stated, “I see this ad every day at Fulton center NYC on the way to work.” The visibility of the Ripple campaign in such a high-traffic area appears to underscore the company’s intention to broaden its awareness efforts to the general public. We are on X, follow us to connect with us :- @TimesTabloid1 — TimesTabloid (@TimesTabloid1) June 15, 2025 Community Feedback Highlights Divided Opinions While the advertisement drew attention from XRP supporters , it also prompted a range of reactions from other users. A comment from a user identified as Bubbles strongly criticized the interpretation that advertising signaled a significant development. The user wrote , “Coca cola advertises, does that mean something big is coming for coca cola……idiot scammers. Get a life. Loser. Find a better job.” The comment reflected skepticism from some quarters of the community, questioning the strategic value or interpretation of commercial advertising as a signal of market movement or technological progress. CryptoSensei did not respond to the critical comment, but engagement with the tweet remained active, indicating that XRP community members continue to closely monitor Ripple’s media strategy. Ripple’s Advertisement Strategy Emphasizes Global Reach In a related report published on June 7 by Times Tabloid, Ripple’s advertising campaign was characterized as a declaration of its international ambitions. Titled “Powering Global Payments for All,” the advertisement highlighted Ripple’s ongoing partnerships with financial institutions such as Santander, TransferGo, and MoneyGram. These companies were featured as examples of Ripple’s current integrations within the cross-border payment ecosystem. Furthermore, the ad directed viewers to Ripple’s official website, where the company details its on-demand liquidity solutions and its intention to modernize traditional financial rails with blockchain-based infrastructure. Ripple’s Focus on Institutional Partnerships and Technology Integration The advertisement’s appearance in a key New York City location appears to be part of a deliberate marketing effort that aligns with Ripple’s ongoing institutional strategy. This development follows a year of intensified visibility for Ripple and XRP amid broader market growth. With new advertisements targeting urban financial centers and recent emphasis on Ripple’s payment infrastructure, the company continues to position itself as a leading entity in the blockchain-driven payments space. Follow us on X , Facebook , Telegram , and Google News The post New Ripple Ad Just Dropped In NYC: XRP Is Making Moves, Something Big Is Unfolding appeared first on Times Tabloid .

title: Shocking Pump.fun X Suspension Fuels SEC Fears in Memecoin Market
body: BitcoinWorld Shocking Pump.fun X Suspension Fuels SEC Fears in Memecoin Market The cryptocurrency world is buzzing following a sudden development involving Pump.fun, a prominent memecoin launchpad operating on the Solana blockchain. The official X accounts for Pump.fun and its founder, Alon Cohen, were abruptly suspended, alongside several other accounts linked to memecoin activities. This unexpected move has ignited widespread speculation across the community, with many wondering about the potential involvement of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). Keeping up with such rapid changes is crucial in the fast-paced realm of Crypto News . What Happened with Pump.fun ‘s Social Presence? The core event that triggered this wave of speculation was the simultaneous suspension of multiple X accounts. The primary accounts affected were: The official @pumpdotfun account. The account belonging to Pump.fun founder, Alon Cohen (@alon). Reports also indicate other accounts associated with memecoin projects or figures saw similar suspensions around the same time. While the platform itself, Pump.fun , reportedly remains fully operational, the loss of its main communication channels on a widely used platform like X is significant. For a project heavily reliant on community engagement and viral marketing, losing access to such a vital platform can disrupt information flow and create uncertainty among users and potential investors. Why the SEC Speculation? The immediate leap to speculating about SEC involvement isn’t unfounded, especially given the current regulatory climate surrounding cryptocurrencies, particularly those perceived as volatile or potentially unregistered securities. Several factors contribute to this speculation: Timing and Scope: The simultaneous suspension of multiple related accounts raises questions about coordinated action, which could potentially originate from a regulatory body investigating a broader issue. Nature of the Platform: Pump.fun facilitates the rapid creation and launch of new tokens, predominantly memecoins. Memecoins, by their nature, are often highly speculative, lack fundamental value, and are prone to extreme volatility. Regulators like the SEC have expressed concerns about platforms that could potentially facilitate the issuance and trading of tokens deemed unregistered securities, or enable manipulative practices like pump-and-dump schemes. Prior Legal Challenges: As highlighted in the initial report, Pump.fun has already faced legal scrutiny. A proposed class-action lawsuit filed in January accused the platform of facilitating the sale of unregistered securities and profiting significantly from fees generated by these activities. Generating nearly $500 million in fees, as alleged, certainly puts the platform on the radar, especially if a significant portion comes from assets later deemed problematic. While X’s terms of service allow for account suspensions for various reasons, including violations related to spam, manipulation, or illegal activities, the timing and the context of the legal challenges make regulatory action a plausible, though unconfirmed, explanation. The Memecoin Market and Associated Risks The rise of platforms like Pump.fun is intrinsically linked to the explosion of the Memecoin market. Memecoins are cryptocurrencies inspired by internet memes, jokes, or cultural trends. They typically gain value through social media hype, community enthusiasm, and speculative trading rather than underlying technology or utility. While some memecoins have seen astronomical gains, attracting significant attention and capital, they are also associated with substantial risks: Extreme Volatility: Prices can surge and plummet dramatically within hours or days, often driven purely by sentiment and social media trends. Lack of Fundamentals: Unlike projects building decentralized applications or solving specific problems, memecoins often have no intrinsic value or clear use case beyond speculation. Pump-and-Dump Schemes: The low liquidity and hype-driven nature of many memecoins make them susceptible to manipulation, where early holders promote the coin heavily to inflate the price before selling off their holdings, leaving later investors with losses. Scams and Rug Pulls: Platforms that lower the barrier to entry for creating tokens can inadvertently become avenues for malicious actors to launch scam tokens, often disappearing with investor funds (a “rug pull”). Platforms that facilitate the easy creation of these tokens face the challenge of balancing accessibility with the need to prevent abuse and protect users from potential fraud and manipulative practices. Regulatory bodies worldwide are increasingly scrutinizing the crypto market, and the memecoin sector, due to its inherent volatility and association with potential scams, is often under a magnifying glass. Solana ‘s Role in the Memecoin Boom Pump.fun operates on the Solana blockchain, which has become a popular hub for memecoin activity. Solana’s architecture, known for its high transaction throughput and low fees, makes it an attractive network for launching and trading tokens quickly and cheaply. This has fostered a vibrant, albeit sometimes chaotic, ecosystem of new projects and tokens, many of which are memecoins. The popularity of Solana for memecoins has been a double-edged sword. On one hand, it has brought significant activity and attention to the network. On the other hand, it has also attracted criticism and regulatory focus due to the proliferation of speculative assets and the associated risks. Developments affecting major platforms on Solana, like Pump.fun, can have ripple effects on the perception and activity within the broader Solana ecosystem. Staying Informed with Crypto News Events like the Pump.fun X account suspension underscore the importance of staying informed in the dynamic world of cryptocurrency. Regulatory actions, platform developments, and market sentiment can change rapidly. For anyone involved in the crypto space, whether as an investor, developer, or enthusiast, reliable Crypto News sources are essential for understanding the landscape, assessing risks, and making informed decisions. While the exact reasons behind the X suspensions remain officially unconfirmed, the incident serves as a stark reminder of the potential regulatory risks faced by platforms operating in less-defined areas of the crypto market, particularly those associated with highly speculative assets like memecoins. It highlights the ongoing tension between innovation in decentralized finance and the need for consumer protection and market integrity that regulators aim to uphold. The situation surrounding Pump.fun will likely continue to develop. Whether regulatory action is indeed underway, or if the suspensions relate to other issues, the event has already fueled significant discussion and highlighted the challenges within the memecoin sector and the platforms that support it. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Solana memecoin activity. This post Shocking Pump.fun X Suspension Fuels SEC Fears in Memecoin Market first appeared on BitcoinWorld and is written by Editorial Team

title: Arthur Hayes Warns Investors Against Chasing the Next Circle
body: Hayes warned that a wave of copycat companies will likely emerge — many of which will be structurally weak, overvalued, and doomed to fail. Despite the bullish sentiment around Circle and the stablecoin sector, Hayes predicts a bubble driven more by hype and poor fundamentals than sustainable value. Meanwhile, Circle CEO Jeremy Allaire compared stablecoins to the iPhone in their early days, and pointed to growing institutional interest and surging transaction volumes as signs of mainstream adoption. Major retailers and platforms like Amazon, Walmart, and Shopify are exploring or integrating stablecoin payments. At the same time, JPMorgan’s new trademark filing for “JPMD” fueled speculation that the bank could soon launch its own stablecoin. Circle Copycats Face Harsh Reality BitMEX founder Arthur Hayes issued a stark warning about the next phase of the crypto market, and described it as the beginning of a new “stablecoin mania” after Circle’s highly successful IPO. In a post on Monday , Hayes said that while Circle’s public listing was a huge milestone for the industry, it is also the start of a bubble that will ultimately burst. He predicted that many companies will try to replicate Circle’s success, but most will be overvalued and ultimately fail due to structural challenges and market saturation. Hayes didn’t mince words in his criticism of these upcoming ventures, and labeled them “Circle copycats.” He also suggested that their business models rely more on showmanship and leverage than sustainable financial practices. He warned investors to be extremely cautious, and described the coming wave of stablecoin stocks as something to be traded like a “hot potato.” Despite his grim outlook, Hayes stopped short of recommending short positions due to the strong pro-crypto sentiment in the US and a narrative-driven surge in demand that could initially drive prices sharply upward. “These new stocks will rip the faces off of shorts,” he cautioned. The US Senate is set to vote on critical stablecoin legislation on June 17, which could lend even more momentum to the sector if passed. Chainlink co-founder Sergey Nazarov agreed with Hayes’ outlook by saying the approval of US regulation would trigger a global explosion in stablecoin projects. However, Hayes pointed out that distribution is still the Achilles’ heel for most new entrants. According to him, without access to major crypto exchanges, social media platforms, or legacy banking systems, new stablecoin companies have little to no chance of survival. Additionally, he argued that the few existing distribution channels are already locked up by incumbents, forcing newcomers to either pay high fees or offer unsustainable yields to attract users. At the same time, he believes Web2 giants and banks are more likely to issue their own stablecoins than partner with new providers. As a result, most new stablecoin IPOs will be speculative hype rather than solid investments. Hayes was particularly scathing toward the upcoming wave of founders, and described them as “suited-up clowns” set to deceive the public into buying into weak companies. Circle share price since launch (Source: Google Finance ) Even Circle (CRCL), he claims, is currently “insanely overvalued,” as half of its interest income is handed over to Coinbase. Yet, he acknowledged that the stock’s price will likely stay elevated due to market enthusiasm. Circle’s share price has surged over 80% since its listing on June 5, and reached an all-time high on June 16. Stablecoins Near iPhone Moment Circle CEO Jeremy Allaire believes that stablecoins are nearing a pivotal moment in mainstream adoption, and compared their current stage to the early days of the iPhone before developers recognized its full potential. In a post on Saturday , Allaire said that while stablecoins haven’t yet attracted developers at the same scale as Apple’s revolutionary product, that breakthrough is coming soon. He described stablecoins as “the highest utility form of money ever created.” Allaire’s comments were made in response to a post by a16z Crypto partner Sam Broner , who argued that stablecoins promote competition by lowering the costs of launching fintech applications. According to Broner, this new openness encourages better pricing, experiences, and accessibility in financial services. The discussion coincides with reports that major retailers like Walmart and Amazon are considering launching their own dollar-backed stablecoins for consumer use. Meanwhile, e-commerce platform Shopify confirmed plans to integrate Circle’s USDC for payments by the end of 2025. A16z Crypto data scientist Daren Matsuoka added to the bullish outlook by stating that stablecoins might be the crypto industry’s best chance to onboard a billion users. He explained that stablecoins have processed $33 trillion in transactions over the past year — which is almost 20 times PayPal’s volume, almost triple that of Visa, and rapidly approaching ACH transaction levels. This surge in adoption momentum follows Circle’s recent listing on the New York Stock Exchange. However, Tether opted not to follow suit. On June 8, Tether CEO Paolo Ardoino confirmed that the company has no plans to go public. New JPMorgan Trademark Sparks Stablecoin Speculation Meanwhile, JPMorgan Chase took a major step toward expanding its presence in the blockchain and digital asset space with a new trademark filing for “JPMD” in the United States. The trademark application was submitted to the US Patent and Trademark Office on Sunday, and outlines a comprehensive suite of crypto-related services, including digital asset trading, exchanges, transfers, clearing, and payment processing. While the application does not specifically mention stablecoins, the breadth of services it covers intensified speculation that JPMorgan may be preparing to launch its own stablecoin. These developments happened on the heels of a report from The Wall Street Journal on May 22, which indicated that JPMorgan, alongside other major financial institutions like Bank of America and Wells Fargo, is actively exploring the launch of a joint stablecoin. The timing of this report and the recent trademark filing led industry observers to draw connections between the two, with some suggesting that JPMorgan’s actions point to an accelerated push into blockchain-native financial infrastructure aimed at competing with established crypto players. Despite CEO Jamie Dimon’s longstanding skepticism toward Bitcoin, JPMorgan maintained a positive stance on blockchain technology as a tool for modernizing traditional finance. The firm already made inroads through its Kinexy platform (previously known as Onyx), which facilitates interbank payments using JPM Coin, a blockchain-based digital token backed 1:1 by fiat currencies including the US dollar, British pound, and euro. To date, Kinexy has handled over $1.5 trillion in tokenized transactions. The news of JPMorgan’s trademark application also arrives at a time of increasing regulatory momentum in the US regarding stablecoins. Last week, the Senate voted 68-30 to advance the Guiding and Establishing National Innovation for US Stablecoins (GENIUS) Act, clearing the way for debate and a full floor vote. If approved by both chambers of Congress, the bill will head to President Donald Trump for final authorization.

title: CoreWeave eyes new highs and outgrows meme stock label
body: CoreWeave is closing in on its all-time peak above $160, suggesting its rally goes beyond being a meme stock. The rise of CRWV coincides with a positive month for miner stocks that pivoted to high-density computing for AI. CoreWeave (CRWV) is back to expansion mode, leading to expectations of another rally. The AI computation company, which pivoted early from Ethereum mining, was one of the biggest winners during the LLM expansion stage. CRWV showed strong bullish momentum in the past month, with periods of trading based on a short squeeze. | Source: Yahoo Finance CRWV climbed to $158.50, on track to repeat previous records above $161. In the last two weeks, the CRWV rally raised suspicions that the stock was boosted by meme traders . However, the company has tapped demand for high-density computation for AI, and got a boost from Nvidia (NVDA). The stock moves on a mix of two major factors—trading based on a potential short squeeze, and general bullish momentum for all AI stocks. CoreWeave goes through another record borrowing period While CRWV is watched for its fundamental potential, in the short term, the price rally coincides with record costs to borrow shares, signaling a short squeeze. During the recent price climb to near-peak prices, CRWV borrowing rates also reached new records. As of June 12, the rate increased to 343.1%, then turned down to around 197%, with 200K CRWV shares available to borrow. CRWV borrowing rates increased to a record, suggesting a short squeeze is a partial factor for the stock’s rally. | Source: CompaniesMarketcap The short interest on CRWV moved within a wide range in the past few days, from 32% to as much as 45%. On social media, messages of short interest of up to 65% of the free float also appeared, boosting the FOMO for trading CRWV. Short interest is not a guaranteed trend, and can shift on a daily basis. However, CRWV can still trade under conditions similar to a short squeeze, at least in the short term. The shares are closely watched for their month-long bullish trend, which may lead to sharp increases in borrowing costs for covering short positions. In June, shares available to borrow increased, potentially easing the borrowing situation, though at a high price. On June 8, only 25K shares were available to borrow, increasing to over 250K at the new record borrowing rates. CoreWeave brings attention to mining companies The success of CoreWeave and demand for computation is boosting the shares of other mining companies. Core Scientific (CORZ) rose by over 12% in the past month. The company may have an ongoing boost from its 12-year deal with CoreWeave, with $4.7B earmarked for data center investments. Core Scientific is also building some of the CoreWeave data centers in Texas, with a goal of tapping 200MW in energy for data centers. The shares are up by 100% since the lows in April and May. The company mixes ongoing BTC mining with a treasury of 977 BTC, while also making forays into computation services. Other companies like CleanSpark and Riot Platforms are still trying to push off their recent lows, with more gradual gains. TeraWulf (WULF) had a more dramatic rally, rising from around $3.50 in early June to over $4.33. The company has previously benefitted from its pivot to AI data centers. It also extends the trend of seeking out renewable electricity resources to create sustainable data centers. title: “Whale Alert” Flagged for New Euro Stablecoin as 10% of EURI Supply Moves to Binance
body: Nearly 10% of EURI’s total supply was transferred to Binance, raising concerns of a potential sell-off. EURI is one of the first Euro stablecoins fully compliant with the EU’s MiCA regulation. MiCA enforcement is reshaping the European stablecoin landscape, with major exchanges racing for licenses. Eurite (EURI), a euro-pegged stablecoin regulated under the European Union’s pioneering Markets in Crypto-Assets (MiCA) regulation, is possibly on the verge of a potential sell-off and incoming volatility. According to on-chain analytics platform Santiment, nearly 10% of EURI’s total supply was recently transferred to Binance. As per CoinMarketCap , EURI currently trades at $1.15, marking a minor 0.10% drop in the last 24 hours. However, this price is slightly above its intended €1.00 peg, a deviation that could be attributed to liquidity dynamics or exchange premiums. Also, the large-scale transfer to Binance could signal downward pressure if the tokens are sold in bulk, as Santiment suggested. Related: Malta’s Crypto License Rush Puts EU’s MiCA Law to the Test What Is Eurite (EURI)? A Look at the MiCA-Regulated Stablecoin Eurite is a stabl… The post “Whale Alert” Flagged for New Euro Stablecoin as 10% of EURI Supply Moves to Binance appeared first on Coin Edition .

title: Ethereum ETF: US Spot ETH ETFs See Promising $21.4M Inflows Start
body: BitcoinWorld Ethereum ETF: US Spot ETH ETFs See Promising $21.4M Inflows Start The anticipation surrounding the launch of US Spot ETH ETFs has been palpable in the crypto market. While trading hasn’t officially begun for all, the underlying funds are starting to see movement. Recent data reveals a notable development: US Spot ETH ETFs collectively recorded a net inflow of $21.4 million on June 16. This marks an important early indicator of investor interest in these newly approved investment vehicles. What Exactly Are US Spot ETH ETFs and Why Do These Inflows Matter? Before diving deeper into the numbers, let’s quickly recap what a US Spot ETH ETF is. It’s an exchange-traded fund that holds actual Ethereum (ETH) as its underlying asset. Unlike futures-based ETFs, which track the price of ETH futures contracts, a spot ETF aims to track the direct market price of Ethereum by holding the asset itself. This structure is generally preferred by investors seeking direct exposure to the asset’s price movements without the complexities of holding the cryptocurrency directly. The approval of US Spot ETH ETFs by the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) earlier this year was a landmark moment for the crypto industry. It followed the successful launch of spot Bitcoin ETFs in January, which saw billions in inflows and significantly boosted Bitcoin’s price and mainstream acceptance. The approval of Ethereum ETFs signals growing regulatory comfort and institutional acceptance of major cryptocurrencies as legitimate asset classes for traditional investment products. Therefore, any recorded inflows into these funds, even before they are fully trading on exchanges (pending S-1 form approvals), are highly significant. They represent the first tangible signs of capital entering these specific investment products, indicating that investors and institutions are beginning to allocate funds towards Ethereum through this regulated and accessible pathway. Breaking Down the Initial ETH ETF Inflows: Who is Leading? According to data compiled by Farside Investors, the $21.4 million net inflow on June 16 was concentrated in just two of the approved funds. Here’s the breakdown: BlackRock’s ETHA: This fund, managed by the world’s largest asset manager, led the pack with a substantial $16.1 million in net inflows. Fidelity’s FETH: Another major financial player, Fidelity, saw its Ethereum ETF attract $5.3 million in net inflows. Other Funds: The remaining US Spot ETH ETFs tracked by Farside Investors reported no change in their holdings for that specific day. This initial data highlights the immediate impact and reach of major financial institutions like BlackRock and Fidelity. Their existing client bases, brand recognition, and distribution networks likely play a significant role in attracting early capital into their respective Ethereum ETF offerings. While $21.4 million is a modest start compared to the massive inflows seen during the initial days of the US spot Bitcoin ETFs, it’s important contextually. The S-1 registration statements, which allow these ETFs to officially begin trading, are still pending final approval for most issuers. These early inflows could represent seed funding or initial strategic allocations ahead of the official launch. How Do These Early ETH ETF Inflows Compare to the Bitcoin Experience? It’s natural to compare the initial performance of US Spot ETH ETF inflows to that of their Bitcoin counterparts. The US spot Bitcoin ETFs saw billions of dollars in inflows within their first few days of trading in January 2024. While the $21.4 million figure for Ethereum ETFs on June 16 is significantly smaller, it’s crucial to remember that this data point represents activity *before* full trading commencement for all funds. The Bitcoin ETFs had their S-1s approved concurrently with the 19b-4 rule change, allowing them to trade almost immediately after the SEC’s decision. The Ethereum ETF process has been slightly different, with 19b-4 approval granted first, followed by the ongoing S-1 approval process for individual issuers. Therefore, a direct day-one comparison isn’t entirely fair. The true test for ETH ETF inflows will come once all major funds receive their S-1 approvals and begin trading on exchanges. However, these early numbers, particularly the interest shown in the BlackRock ETH ETF and Fidelity ETH ETF , suggest that there is indeed appetite among investors for this new product. What Could These Initial Flows Signal for the Future of Ethereum? While it’s too early to make definitive predictions based on a single day’s data, these initial ETH ETF inflows are generally viewed as a positive sign for Ethereum. Here’s why: Growing Institutional Interest: The participation of major firms like BlackRock and Fidelity, and the capital they are attracting, underscores increasing institutional comfort and interest in gaining exposure to Ethereum. Increased Accessibility: Once fully operational, these ETFs will make investing in Ethereum significantly easier for traditional investors who are uncomfortable with or unable to navigate cryptocurrency exchanges and private key management. This expanded access could bring new capital into the ETH market. Potential Price Support: As ETFs accumulate ETH to back their shares, this creates buying pressure on the underlying asset. While the initial $21.4 million is small relative to Ethereum’s market cap, sustained inflows over time could provide significant price support. Market Legitimacy: The existence of regulated ETF products for Ethereum further solidifies its position as a recognized and legitimate asset class within the traditional financial system. Navigating the Path Ahead: Challenges and Opportunities While the launch of Ethereum ETF products presents significant opportunities, there are also potential challenges to consider: Opportunities: Massive Capital Influx: If ETH ETFs mirror the success of Bitcoin ETFs, they could unlock significant capital from retail and institutional investors who were previously unable or unwilling to invest directly in crypto. Enhanced Liquidity: Increased trading activity around the ETFs could indirectly improve liquidity in the underlying ETH market. Innovation in Financial Products: The success of spot crypto ETFs could pave the way for other regulated products based on digital assets. Challenges: Market Volatility: While ETFs offer a regulated wrapper, they still track a highly volatile asset. Investors must be prepared for significant price swings. Regulatory Uncertainty: Although the ETFs are approved, the broader regulatory landscape for cryptocurrencies in the US remains complex and subject to change. Competition: The market is competitive, with multiple issuers vying for investor assets. Performance and fees will be key differentiators. Staking Exclusion: Importantly, the current US spot ETH ETFs are approved without a staking component, meaning investors in these funds will not earn staking rewards, which is a significant feature of holding native ETH. Actionable Insights for Those Watching US Spot ETH ETFs For investors and market observers, here are a few key takeaways: Monitor S-1 Approvals: Keep a close eye on the SEC’s approval timeline for the remaining S-1 registration statements. This will be the green light for full trading commencement. Track Inflow Data Post-Launch: Once trading begins, daily inflow/outflow data will provide a clearer picture of investor demand compared to these early seed figures. Observe Market Reaction: See how the price of Ethereum reacts as these ETFs go live and accumulate assets. Compare Performance: If considering investment (not financial advice), compare the fees, structure, and performance of different ETF offerings. Remember, investing in cryptocurrencies and related products carries significant risk. This information is for educational purposes only and should not be construed as financial advice. Always conduct your own thorough research and consult with a qualified financial advisor before making any investment decisions. The Broader Significance Beyond Just the ETF It’s also worth remembering that the Ethereum ETF is just one part of the larger Ethereum ecosystem. Ethereum is a foundational layer for decentralized finance (DeFi), non-fungible tokens (NFTs), and numerous other decentralized applications. Its ongoing technical upgrades, such as the transition to Proof-of-Stake and future scaling solutions, are critical drivers of its long-term value proposition, independent of the ETF wrapper. The ETF provides a new gateway for traditional capital, but the underlying technology and network development remain paramount. Concluding Thoughts: A Promising Start for a New Era The reported $21.4 million in net inflows on June 16 for US Spot ETH ETFs represents a modest but symbolically significant step forward. It confirms early interest from major players like BlackRock and Fidelity and signals the impending arrival of these highly anticipated investment products to the broader market. While the true impact will unfold once full trading commences, this initial activity sets a positive tone for the potential integration of Ethereum into traditional investment portfolios. The journey of US spot ETH ETFs is just beginning, and market participants will be keenly watching to see if the early promise translates into sustained growth and adoption. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Ethereum institutional adoption. This post Ethereum ETF: US Spot ETH ETFs See Promising $21.4M Inflows Start first appeared on BitcoinWorld and is written by Editorial Team

title: On-Chain Analyst Warns: Bitcoin Peak Expected, Altcoins Facing -95% Plunge
body: As Bitcoin (BTC) and the broader cryptocurrency market show tentative signs of recovery following the most recent correction, a crypto analyst has made a bold statement suggesting that the market may have already reached its peak. BladeDeFi, in a recent post on X (formerly Twitter), warned followers that a significant downturn could be on the horizon, predicting a challenging summer ahead for the crypto space. Crypto Pump Or Trap? In his post, BladeDeFi emphasized that “crypto has already PEAKED” and forecasted a potential slump where alternative cryptocurrencies could see declines of up to 95%. He indicated that most indicators are flashing red, suggesting that the market is on the brink of a significant downturn. According to him, Bitcoin has already hit its all-time high early in the current cycle and is now trapped in a “slow-motion downtrend,” with each subsequent bounce becoming weaker than the last. Related Reading: Bitcoin Gold Rush 2.0? Treasuries Swell With 60 New Players The analyst pointed out a concerning trend: retail investors are becoming exhausted, while larger institutional players have begun to exit the market. Major firms like BlackRock, Fidelity, and MicroStrategy are reportedly rotating their investments and hedging their positions, often without making their actions overtly public. The analyst suggests that this shift leaves retail investors vulnerable, potentially left holding depreciating assets as liquidity in the market continues to dwindle. BladeDeFi also criticized the current market dynamics, warning that sudden price increases or “green candles” are often deceptive, serving only to entice late buyers into traps that lead to further losses. He noted that without new capital inflows—such as fresh stimulus or significant investment—the recent price pumps lack sustainability. The absence of liquidity means that any upward movements are likely to be fleeting, and the overall trend remains downward. Bitcoin Poised For Year-End Peak? Adding to the bearish sentiment, another analyst, Peppeso, echoed similar concerns, suggesting that the top of the 2025 bull market has already been established. Peppeso observed historical patterns in previous market cycles, noting that while bull markets have become longer, bear markets have shortened and softened in their impact. Despite this, Bitcoin has consistently reached all-time highs in the final months of each cycle, reinforcing Peppeso’s expectation of a peak around November or December 2025. Related Reading: Ethereum Consolidation Continues – Altseason May Follow A Clean Break Above Resistance The current market environment is further complicated by macroeconomic factors, including rising interest rates and increasing geopolitical risks. With uncertainty clouding the outlook, many investors are adopting a risk-off approach, leading to a sustained downtrend in the crypto market. Even popular memecoins like Dogecoin (DOGE) and Shiba Inu (SHIB) have experienced significant declines of 9% and 7% in the past week alone respectively, indicating that the hype surrounding these assets is fading. Featured image from DALL-E, chart from TradingView.com

title: When Will XRP vs SEC Officially End? Could Settle Within 1 Week to 2 Months
body: The post When Will XRP vs SEC Officially End? Could Settle Within 1 Week to 2 Months appeared first on Coinpedia Fintech News In a latest twist in the Ripple vs SEC case, both parties have asked the Second Circuit Court to keep the appeals process on hold while they wait for a ruling from the district court. The SEC is expected to update the court with a status report by August 15. This comes after a joint request was filed by Ripple and the SEC on June 12 to lift the injunction and reduce the penalty. The final outcome now depends on how the district court rules on that request. If the court approves the proposed settlement, it could finally mark the end of this case. Otherwise, it could face new delays. All eyes are now on the next update, which is expected by mid-August. Update Likely Within a Week? One expert explains that the SEC refiled the motion with Judge Torres, and her response will guide the next steps. She also added that it might not take until August, as the last time Judge Torres responded within just 7 days, so a decision could come as early as Thursday or next week. Former SEC official Marc Fagel commented that writing legal opinions takes time and pointed out that this isn’t the only case in front of the judge. Will the Case Return to Judge Torres? Sherrie expressed that she would be surprised if Judge Torres were to reject the refiled motion. The community might need to be prepared for the possibility that, if the motion is not approved and either party restarts their appeals, the case could end back up in Judge Torres’ courtroom. This could trigger “conspiracy theories” within the XRP community. I don't think there's any way to predict whether she will modify her order. I could see it going either way. — Marc Fagel (@Marc_Fagel) June 17, 2025 According to Fagel, it’s hard to predict whether the judge will modify her previous order. “I could see it going either way,” he said. So, both sides are now waiting on Judge Torres. If she accepts the motion, it could help wrap up the case. If not, the appeals process may restart and lead to more speculation across the community. If the case is resolved, it could boost XRP’s price and make way for spot XRP ETF approvals. As of now, XRP is trading around $2.22, up 1% in the past day

title: Arthur Hayes Predicts Stablecoin Bubble After Circle’s IPO Surge
body: BitMEX co-founder Arthur Hayes has issued a stark warning to investors following Circle’s successful public listing, predicting that the market is entering a phase of “stablecoin mania” that could end in widespread failures and financial losses. In a Monday blog post, Hayes expressed skepticism about a potential wave of copycat stablecoin companies aiming to replicate Circle’s (CRCL) IPO success . Hayes emphasized that Circle’s listing is likely just the beginning of a broader speculative frenzy. “The listing marks the beginning, not the end of this cycle’s stablecoin mania,” he wrote. He foresees a situation where companies attract massive investments by using financial tricks, excessive leverage, and flashy marketing—but ultimately lack a solid foundation. “The bubble will pop after a stablecoin issuer convinces investors to part with tens of billions, only to collapse,” he warned. New Entrants in Stablecoin World According to Hayes, most new stablecoin companies won’t survive. He outlined that the real challenge for these firms lies in distribution—specifically, how and where they get their stablecoins into users’ hands. Hayes identified three main distribution avenues: cryptocurrency exchanges, Web2 social media giants, and traditional banks. He argued that without access to at least one of these, a new stablecoin issuer has “no chance of success.” He added that existing players have already secured these routes, making it nearly impossible for newcomers to enter without paying significant fees or giving up yield. He noted that social media companies and banks are more likely to develop their own stablecoins rather than partner with third-party issuers. Despite his grim outlook, Hayes refrained from advising traders to short these companies’ stocks. “These new stocks will rip the faces off of shorts,” he wrote, citing the growing pro-crypto sentiment in the U.S. and momentum around stablecoin legislation. The U.S. Senate is expected to vote on a major stablecoin bill on June 17, which could further energize the market. Circle Soars Amid Caution Hayes was particularly critical of Circle’s current valuation, describing CRCL as significantly overvalued. He noted that Circle shares 50% of its interest earnings with Coinbase, which he sees as a structural weakness. Nevertheless, he acknowledged that the stock price is likely to remain high for now due to market hype. Circle’s share price has surged over 80% since its June 5 debut, hitting nearly $165 on June 16, according to Google Finance. Hayes sees this as a sign of things to come—but not in a good way. The post Arthur Hayes Predicts Stablecoin Bubble After Circle’s IPO Surge appeared first on TheCoinrise.com .

title: Bitcoin Pepe price outlook as another firm raises funds to buy BTC
body: Bitcoin edged higher on Tuesday even as broader cryptocurrency markets posted a mixed performance and global financial markets paused amid the continuing conflict between Israel and Iran . Both stocks and digital assets fell sharply on Friday following renewed Israeli strikes but began to stabilize on Monday. By early Tuesday, however, momentum had stalled . US index futures slipped, and cryptocurrency price action turned mixed over the previous 24 hours. Digital assets often mirror high-risk technology stocks—rising with investor optimism and reversing course when sentiment weakens. Geopolitical shocks typically trigger knee-jerk sell-offs, but markets tend to stabilize as traders reassess the broader implications. Amid this volatile backdrop, early-stage project Bitcoin Pepe has continued to see strong presale inflows. Since launching in February, the project has maintained steady investor interest, positioning itself as a notable outlier in an otherwise cooling meme coin segment. Firms continue to load up BTC The Blockchain Group has raised €7.2 million (approximately $7.7 million) to advance its ambition of becoming Europe’s leading Bitcoin Treasury company. In a press release dated June 17, the Paris-listed firm said the capital was secured via an “At-The-Market type” raise with asset manager TOBAM. The offering involved the issuance of 1.6 million new shares at an average price of €4.49, reflecting a 20.76% discount to the stock’s June 13 close amid market volatility. The Blockchain Group @_ALTBG · Follow 🟠The Blockchain Group announces a capital increase totalling ~€7.2 million at an average price of ~€4.49 per share as part of its “ATM-type” capital increase program with TOBAM to pursue its Bitcoin Treasury Company strategy⚡️Full Press Release (EN): theblockchain-group.com/wp-content/upl… 11:33 am · 17 Jun 2025 184 Reply Copy link Read 10 replies Proceeds from the raise will support the company’s ongoing accumulation of Bitcoin as part of a treasury strategy. The Blockchain Group aims to emulate firms such as US-based Strategy and Japan’s Metaplanet, which have adopted similar Bitcoin-forward capital allocation models. It plans to hold up to 260,000 BTC—currently valued at about $24 billion—by 2033, positioning itself as a pioneer of corporate Bitcoin adoption in Europe. Bitcoin Pepe: listing announcement scheduled for today Even amid a volatile market, the accelerating embrace of Bitcoin and digital assets by traditional finance has helped lift sentiment across the broader crypto ecosystem. In this risk-on climate, investors in search of outsized returns are rotating back into speculative plays—meme coins among the first to benefit. Among them, Bitcoin Pepe has emerged as one of 2025’s most closely tracked presales. The project distinguishes itself with the ambition to “build Solana on Bitcoin,” aiming to merge the Bitcoin network’s security with Solana-style scalability. The project’s PEP-20 token standard allows permissionless minting and trading on the Bitcoin network. Unlike meme tokens that rely purely on hype, Bitcoin Pepe is anchored by a defined technical roadmap and infrastructure-led narrative. The project has raised over $14.6 million in presale funding ahead of a planned listing announcement today, underscoring continued investor interest. As speculative capital flows back into early-stage assets, Bitcoin Pepe is well-positioned to harness the momentum in the final stretch of its token sale. title: Best crypto to buy now as Truth Social files for Bitcoin-Ether ETF
body: Bitcoin (BTC) edged higher above $107,000 on Tuesday, building on Monday’s 1.14% gain. The cryptocurrency briefly touched a 24-hour high of $108,952 before pulling back to $106,000. Market sentiment improved following comments from French President Emmanuel Macron , who said that US President Donald Trump had received an offer—delivered through intermediaries—intended to secure a ceasefire and resume broader negotiations between the warring parties. “There is indeed an offer to meet and exchange. An offer was made especially to get a ceasefire and to kickstart broader discussions,” Macron told reporters that the development was a potentially positive step in resolving the Iran-Israel conflict. The broader market rebound is also benefiting early-stage tokens such as Bitcoin Pepe , which has continued to draw steady investor interest since its presale launch in February. Over the weekend, the project recorded more than $250,000 in new inflows, underscoring sustained momentum as traders seek high-upside opportunities amid improving sentiment. Trump’s Truth Social files for Bitcoin-Ether ETF Truth Social, the social media platform operated by Trump Media & Technology Group, has filed to launch an exchange-traded fund tracking the prices of both bitcoin and ether. According to a Form S-1 filed Monday with the US Securities and Exchange Commission, the proposed “Truth Social Bitcoin and Ethereum ETF, B.T.” will allocate approximately 75% of its assets to bitcoin, with the remaining portion invested in ether. The ratio may be adjusted at the discretion of the sponsor, Yorkville America Digital LLC, with any changes to be disclosed via prospectus supplements, SEC filings, or updates on the fund’s website. Foris DAX Trust Co. LLC is listed as the custodian, as in the platform’s earlier filing for a single-asset bitcoin ETF submitted on June 5. Truth Social is the third issuer to seek approval for a dual-spot crypto ETF, following similar filings by Bitwise and Hashdex. Other firms, including Volatility Shares and ProShares, have filed for bitcoin-ether ETFs as well, but tied to futures markets rather than spot prices. Bitcoin Pepe continues its forward march Bitcoin’s resilience amid macroeconomic uncertainty is lifting broader crypto market sentiment, rekindling speculative appetite across digital assets. Historically, such periods have often preceded market-wide rallies, especially in high-volatility segments like meme coins. Investors are once again rotating into riskier bets, with meme tokens among the early beneficiaries. One project gaining momentum is Bitcoin Pepe, which merges viral internet culture with a Layer 2 infrastructure play. Bitcoin Pepe is attempting to “build Solana on Bitcoin.” The project seeks to pair Bitcoin’s base-layer security with Solana-style scalability, distinguishing it from meme tokens that rely purely on hype. Unlike most of its peers, Bitcoin Pepe is underpinned by a technical roadmap and infrastructure-first narrative. That positioning appears to be resonating: the project has raised more than $14.6 million in its ongoing presale, with a listing announcement due today. As capital continues to rotate into early-stage, high-upside opportunities, Bitcoin Pepe is positioning itself to capitalise on renewed risk-taking in the final days of its token sale. title: Asia FX Faces Tremors: Geopolitical Risk and Yen Strength Explained
body: BitcoinWorld Asia FX Faces Tremors: Geopolitical Risk and Yen Strength Explained In the dynamic world of finance, global events ripple across various markets. For those following cryptocurrency, understanding broader macro trends, including shifts in Asia FX and other Currency Markets , is crucial. Recently, a confluence of factors – primarily escalating Geopolitical Risk in the Middle East and strategic moves by the Bank of Japan (BOJ) – has put significant pressure on Asian currencies while boosting the Japanese Yen . This complex interplay of international tension and central bank action is shaping the immediate outlook for forex traders and investors worldwide. Why is Asia FX Feeling the Pressure? Asian currencies have recently experienced a downturn, dipping against the US dollar and other safe-haven assets. Several factors contribute to this vulnerability: Increased Risk Aversion: Heightened Geopolitical Risk , particularly the tensions between Israel and Iran, prompts investors to move away from assets perceived as riskier, which often includes emerging market and Asian currencies. Capital tends to flow towards safer havens like the US dollar, the Swiss Franc, and the Japanese Yen . Sensitivity to Global Shocks: Asian economies are deeply integrated into global supply chains and trade. Any threat to global stability or trade routes can negatively impact their economic outlook and currency strength. Differential Central Bank Policies: While some global central banks are contemplating rate cuts, others like the BOJ have only recently started moving away from ultra-loose policy. This divergence in BOJ Monetary Policy and that of other regional central banks can create pressure points for Asia FX . Commodity Price Volatility: Rising tensions can impact oil prices and other commodities, affecting the trade balances and inflation outlooks for importing and exporting nations in Asia, further influencing their currencies. This collective pressure leads to depreciation in various Asian currencies, making imports more expensive and potentially impacting inflation targets and economic stability in the region. The Rise of the Japanese Yen: A Safe Haven Amidst Tension? While much of Asia FX has been under pressure, the Japanese Yen has shown relative strength, or at least resilience, and has even firmed up recently. This might seem counterintuitive given Japan’s economic challenges, but it highlights the Yen’s enduring status as a safe-haven currency during times of global uncertainty. When Geopolitical Risk rises, investors often flock to assets perceived as stable and liquid, and the Yen fits this description. Furthermore, recent developments regarding BOJ Monetary Policy have played a significant role. The Bank of Japan’s decision to finally exit negative interest rates and end its yield curve control policy marked a pivotal shift. This move, while modest, signals a potential path towards tighter monetary conditions in Japan, increasing the attractiveness of Yen-denominated assets relative to a period of near-zero or negative rates. This policy pivot, combined with safe-haven demand driven by Geopolitical Risk , has provided a floor, and at times, a boost to the Japanese Yen against many other currencies, including some within Currency Markets in Asia. Decoding BOJ Monetary Policy’s Impact on Currency Markets The Bank of Japan’s recent policy adjustments are perhaps the most significant change in BOJ Monetary Policy in years. After maintaining ultra-low interest rates for an extended period to combat deflation, the BOJ raised its short-term policy rate target to a range of 0% to 0.1%. Key aspects of this shift include: Ending Negative Rates: This move formally concludes an eight-year experiment with negative interest rates. Scrapping Yield Curve Control (YCC): The BOJ will no longer directly control the yield on 10-year Japanese government bonds, allowing market forces more influence. Halting ETF/J-REIT Purchases: The central bank will stop buying exchange-traded funds and Japanese real estate investment trusts, unwinding unconventional stimulus measures. Continued JGB Purchases: The BOJ stated it would continue buying Japanese government bonds, though the amount might decrease over time. This shift in BOJ Monetary Policy reduces the yield differential between Japanese bonds and those in other countries, making the Yen potentially more attractive for carry trades (borrowing in a low-interest currency to invest in a high-interest one). While the initial rate hike was small, the *direction* of policy change is significant for Currency Markets and provides fundamental support for the Japanese Yen , counteracting some of the depreciation pressures it faced when rates elsewhere were much higher. How Does Geopolitical Risk Influence Currency Flows? The current elevated level of Geopolitical Risk stemming from the Middle East conflict has a direct and immediate impact on Currency Markets . Here’s how: Flight to Safety: Investors panic or become cautious, selling assets they perceive as risky (stocks, emerging market bonds, some Asia FX ) and buying traditional safe havens (US Dollar, Gold, Swiss Franc, Japanese Yen ). This capital movement directly affects currency valuations. Impact on Oil Prices: The Middle East is a major oil-producing region. Tensions there often lead to spikes in oil prices. For oil-importing nations in Asia, this means higher import costs, potentially widening trade deficits and weakening their currencies. Oil-exporting nations might see their currencies strengthen, but overall risk aversion often outweighs this. Supply Chain Disruptions: While not immediately apparent, prolonged conflict could threaten shipping lanes or supply chains, impacting economies reliant on trade and potentially weakening their currencies. Uncertainty: Markets dislike uncertainty. The unpredictable nature of geopolitical events makes investors hesitant to commit capital to riskier assets, favoring the stability offered by major reserve currencies and safe havens like the Japanese Yen . This heightened Geopolitical Risk environment is a primary driver behind the recent divergence observed between the struggling Asia FX complex and the relatively stronger performance of the Japanese Yen . What’s Next for Asia FX and the Japanese Yen? The outlook for Asia FX and the Japanese Yen remains closely tied to these dominant themes: Geopolitical Risk and central bank policy, particularly BOJ Monetary Policy and the actions of other major central banks like the US Federal Reserve. Key factors to watch include: De-escalation or Escalation: Any significant change in the Middle East situation will immediately impact risk sentiment and currency flows. De-escalation could see some recovery in Asia FX , while escalation would likely boost the Japanese Yen and other safe havens further. Future BOJ Moves: While the BOJ exited negative rates, the pace of future rate hikes is uncertain. Any hints from the BOJ about further tightening or dovish signals could significantly move the Japanese Yen . US Dollar Strength: The US dollar remains a primary safe haven. Its trajectory, influenced by Fed policy and US economic data, will heavily impact all Currency Markets , including Asia FX and the Yen. Economic Data from Asia: Inflation, growth, and trade data from key Asian economies will also play a role in determining the resilience of their currencies against external pressures. For investors, navigating these Currency Markets requires careful attention to both macro-geopolitical developments and specific central bank communications. The current environment underscores the importance of understanding how global risk translates into currency movements. Concluding Thoughts The recent dips in Asia FX and the relative strength of the Japanese Yen are clear indicators of how global Geopolitical Risk and central bank decisions, notably the recent shift in BOJ Monetary Policy , are shaping the landscape of Currency Markets . The tension in the Middle East has amplified demand for safe havens, benefiting the Yen, while simultaneously increasing risk aversion towards other Asian currencies. As these complex dynamics continue to unfold, staying informed about both geopolitical developments and monetary policy shifts will be essential for anyone involved in the forex space or interested in the broader macroeconomic factors influencing global finance. To learn more about the latest Forex market, macro trends, geo-political trends, explore our articles on key developments shaping global liquidity, institutional adoption, etc. This post Asia FX Faces Tremors: Geopolitical Risk and Yen Strength Explained first appeared on BitcoinWorld and is written by Editorial Team
